title: 2 game remake + Low priority + LP losses
body:
Don't know what to say anymore... Stuck in loading screen at 100%. How would I know that game has started and the cilent has crashed. By the time i realised league crashed, game has been remake and I have been place in low priority... 
Hopefully this can be looked into and solved 
EDIT: I have to stress that none of these were intentional. There were neither bug splats nor any indication that league has crashed until you start clicking or using Ctrl+Alt+Delete.

replies.body:
When someone disconnects from a game, it negatively impacts the match for all players, regardless of the reason for the disconnection. This is why the system treats all disconnections equally and penalties cannot be modified or removed. Typically when your client acts in the manner you're describing, it's because the client is losing connection to the servers. There can be many causes to why your client would lose connection to the servers and our [Connection Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) goes over the most common fixes.

Let me know if these steps helped resolve your issue.

Well, i went through with all of them and it did help, however, a new thing has emerged. Ping spikes during games. 30ms normally and proceed to 300ms in fights or during log in screen or when i hit play button. I noticed it through command promt when pinging the EUW servers. 

I also tried repeating these steps but pinging another IP address and get no disparity which suggest to me that it should not be my end?

If changing your local settings causes no change, paired with the latency (ping) inconsistencies, it's likely there are issues along your ISP routing to the server. I recommend running a set of logs using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs) and a [traceroute](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2), then attaching them to a [ticket submission](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). Our tech team will be able to use these logs to track down where the core issue is.

Let me know if you have any questions.
That's generally why I wear headphones, so I can hear the crash when it happens. Riot should really fix it though, I get it about once a day dependant on how much I play.
